## 판결문 요약


317 N.E.2d 200 (1974)
Alexander McAllister, Appellant (Defendant below),
v.
STATE of Indiana, Appellee (Plaintiff below).
No. 2-973A195.
Court of Appeals of Indiana, Second District.
October 10, 1974.
Rehearing Denied December 12, 1974.
*201 Philip E. Tracy, Indianapolis, for appellant.
Theodore L. Sendak, Atty. Gen., William S. McMaster, Deputy Atty. Gen., Indianapolis, for appellee.
Rehearing Denied December 12, 1974. See Ind. App., 319 N.E.2d 866.
BUCHANAN, Judge.

CASE SUMMARY
Defendant-Appellant Alexander McAllister (McAllister) appeals from a trial court judgment convicting him of First Degree Arson claiming insufficient evidence.
We reverse.

FACTS
The facts and evidence most favorable to the State are:
On Friday, February 16, 1973, at 9:25 P.M., McAllister, an employee of the Thomas & Skinner Company located at 1120 East 23rd Street, Indianapolis, was observed leaving the plant by the security officer. At approximately 9:30 P.M. McAllister was seen by his sister-in-law, Julia Spann, at the St. Jude Church at 975 Delaware Street where his estranged wife and children and Miss Spann were attending church services.
At 9:45 P.M., the Indianapolis Fire Department arrived at 2411 North Capitol Avenue to find that the upper duplex at that address, occupied by McAllister's estranged wife and their children and her sister (Julia Spann), was on fire.
